contents: A plain white flag was flown by the Taliban. In 1997 the Taliban introduced the Shahadah on a white flag. After the fall of the Taliban, the traditional black, red and green colors were restored. The center emblem is the classical emblem of Afghanistan with a mosque with its mihrab facing Mecca.

This flag consists of three vertical stripes of the colors black, red, and green. This has been present on most flags of Afghanistan in the last twenty years. The center emblem is the classical emblem of Afghanistan with a mosque with its mihrab facing Mecca.

The current form of the flag is inspired by the flag that was used during the monarchy and differs only in the national emblem in the middle of the flag. Currently, it consists of a vertical tricolor of black, red, and green and national emblem in the middle of the red stripe.
